name: perseus-plugins
body:
### Welcome to the Perseus plugin repository
Here you can find the interfaces that are required for the development of plugins for the Perseus software. Furthermore the source code for numerous standard plugins can be found here.

### Perseus
Perseus is written in C# using the .NET Framework 4.5.
Supported operating systems are 
* Windows Vista SP2 (x86 and x64)
* Windows 7 SP1 (x86 and x64)
* Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1 (x64)
* Windows Server 2008 SP2 (x86 and x64)
* Windows 8
* Windows Server 2012

### Contents
The download contains a Solution for Visual Studio 2012. It can be opened with Visual Studio Express 2012 for Widnows Desktop which can be downloaded for free from 
[http://www.microsoft.com/visualstudio/eng/downloads#d-2012-express](http://www.microsoft.com/visualstudio/eng/downloads#d-2012-express). After 30 days you will have to register for ongoing free use. The solution contains two project folders and another folder for required DLLs.

```
DLLs
PerseusApi
PerseusPluginLib
perseusPlugins.sln
README.md
```

### PerseusApi
This project contains the interfaces according to which the plugins are programmed. `IMatrixData` represents the structure of the data that is passed from activity to activity. The five main types of activities correspond to the interfaces
* `IMatrixUpload`
* `IMatrixProcessing`
* `IMatrixAnalysis`
* `IMatrixCombination`
* `IMatrixExport`

### PerseusPluginLib
This project contains the source code for more than 40 standard plugins. 

### Further information
* [Google group for plugin development](http://groups.google.com/group/perseus-plugins)
* [Google group for Perseus](http://groups.google.com/group/perseus-list)
* [Perseus page](http://www.perseus-framework.org/) (under development)
* [MaxQuant page](http://www.maxquant.org/)
* [YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKYzYTm1cnmc0CFAMhxDO8w)
tagline: Perseus is a software framework for the statistical analysis of omics data. It has a plugin architecture which allows users to contribute their own data analysis activities. Here you find the code necessary to develop your own plugins.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
